title: How 'Messi Magic' Saved 90-Year-Old Argentine Woman During Hamas' Oct 7 Attack On Israel (WATCH) | MENAFN.COM
text:
( MENAFN - AsiaNet News) On October 7, 2023, when Hamas terrorists burst into a 90-year-old woman's home in Israel's Kibbutz Nir Oz, Esther Cunio did the unthinkable. The elderly woman discussed her Argentine heritage and the fact that she was born in legendary footballer Lionel Messi's home nation. Surprisingly, 'Messi' did the magic for Esther.
Not only did she make it through the attack, but she even posed for a brief video with a Hamas gunman while he was holding his assault rifle.
The Times of Israel reported that eight members of her extended family were captured during the Hamas attack, which led to a large-scale ground assault by the Israel Defense Forces (IDF). The rest of her family was freed as part of the peace agreement, but her two grandkids and one of their partners remain detained in Gaza.
Five months since the attack by the Palestinian terrorist group, Esther Cunio is set to feature in a brand-new documentary on the horrifying assault that started the current conflict in Gaza.
Five months on, Cunio is set to feature in a new documentary on the Hamas attack that prompted the ongoing war in Gaza.
In a clip from the documentary "Voces de 7 de octubre - Latino Stories of Survival" which is still in the making, the 90-year-old woman narrated what had happened on that fateful day.
On October 7, Cunio recalled in the film, two Hamas terrorists knocked on her door and asked about her family. Her life was soon saved by an unexpected turn of events in the conversation.
"Do you watch football?" she asked them.
To a nod from a Hamas gunman, she replied, "I am from where Messi is from."
"I like Messi," said one of them, brimming with excitement upon hearing the name of Argentina's 2022 World Cup winning captain.
Then, for a video, he had her strike a stance with his gun and a victory sign.
Recounting the encounter in the upcoming documentary, she hoped Messi would realize that she made it through that day because of the Inter Miami star and former Barcelona legend.

title: Gobernadora Marina del Pilar promueve el programa "Familias de Corazón" que brinda hogares temporales a menores del DIF - San Diego Red | Noticias, cultura y gastronomía de Cali-Baja
text:
Durante la conferencia matutina de este miércoles, la gobernadora de Baja California, Marina del Pilar Ávila Olmeda, reafirmó el compromiso de su administración con la protección de la infancia vulnerable a través del programa “Familias del Corazón”.
Esta iniciativa, impulsada por el DIF estatal, tiene como objetivo fundamental brindar un hogar temporal lleno de afecto, seguridad y apoyo integral a niñas, niños y adolescentes. Específicamente a menores que, por diversas circunstancias, han sido separados de sus familias biológicas.
Te podría interesar: Emprendedoras de Baja California podrán solicitar apoyo de hasta $20 mil pesos: Gobernadora Marina del Pilar.
Un hogar temporal para un futuro mejor en la niñez bajacaliforniana
El programa “Familias del Corazón”, inaugurado el 22 de abril de 2022, permite que los menores bajo la tutela del DIF estatal crezcan en un entorno familiar mientras se resuelve su situación jurídica. La gobernadora destacó, que actualmente se cuenta con la participación de 10 familias certificadas en todo el estado y se ha beneficiado a 15 menores.
“Este esfuerzo representa una esperanza tangible para quienes más lo necesitan. Queremos que cada niño y niña sepa que hay un lugar donde puede sanar, aprender y soñar” destacó la mandataria estatal.
Por su parte, la Directora General de DIF Estatal, Diana Asunción Pérez Álvarez, detalló que el programa busca restituir el derecho fundamental de niños, niñas y adolescentes a vivir en familia. “Es una alternativa que impide la institucionalización, generando un impacto positivo y duradero en sus vidas” señaló.
La funcionaria informó que actualmente hay cuatro menores en acogimiento activo y la autoridad estatal mantiene vigilancia constante para garantizar el bienestar de los niños y jóvenes.
El objetivo principal es ofrecer un ambiente seguro y afectuoso por un período que puede oscilar entre los seis meses y un año, donde los menores reciban no solo un techo, sino también cariño, estabilidad emocional, apoyo educativo continuo y un acompañamiento integral en su comunidad.
Continúa leyendo: Gobierno de Marina del Pilar anuncia a Baja California como líder de inversión extranjera directa en 2025.
Marina del Pilar hace un llamado a la solidaridad de las familias bajacalifornianas
La gobernadora Ávila Olmeda hizo un llamado a la ciudadanía para que más familias se sumen a este programa, enfatizando que no estarán solas. Contarán con el respaldo de un equipo multidisciplinario de la Procuraduría de Protección de Niñas, Niños y Adolescentes. Además serán guiados exhaustivamente a través de las etapas de información, evaluación rigurosa, preparación integral y certificación formal.
Marina del Pilar mencionó que el programa aspira a ofrecer mucho más que un techo, busca a corazones generosos dispuesto a brindar amor y apoyo. Los interesados en formar parte, pueden comunicarse al WhatsApp 686 155 6595 o al correo electrónico familaisdecorazonbc@gmail.com.
Cabe destacar, que actualmente, otras dos familias se encuentran en la fase final del proceso de certificación para unirse al programa.
La gobernadora también destacó que a través de los esfuerzos del DIF estatal en materia de restitución familiar. Desde noviembre de 2021 hasta la fecha, 4 mil 408 niños y adolescentes han sido reintegrados exitosamente a sus familias de origen. Mientras que otros 190 niños han encontrado un hogar permanente a través de la adopción. Esto refleja un continuo compromiso de la actual administración con el bienestar de las infancias.

author: Mary Walrath-Holdridge
title: Kathleen Wilson's Minnesota dentist did 30 procedures at once: lawsuit
text: 20 fillings, 4 root canals, 8 crowns in one visit add up to lawsuit for Minnesota dentist [Mary Walrath-Holdridge](https://www.usatoday.com/staff/12093029002/mary-walrathholdridge/) A Minnesota dentist has become the subject of a malpractice lawsuit after his patient accused him of "disfiguring" her. The civil lawsuit was filed in Hennepin County, Minnesota last week by Kathleen Wilson, who alleged Dr. Kevin Molldrem and [Molldrem Family Dentistry](https://molldremdentistry.com/) caused her significant injury that is still being corrected. According to the suit, Molldrem performed more than 30 producers on Wilson in a single July 2020 visit, doing eight crowns, four root canals and 20 fillings in one go. The lawsuit alleges that the dentist "perform[ed] this work improperly," resulting in pain and suffering, embarrassment, emotional distress, and disfigurement. Molldrem was likewise accused of using improper levels of anesthesia during the procedures and falsifying medical records to cover it up. Treatment called 'inconceivable' “It is inconceivable that Dr. Molldrem could have prepared and placed 8 crowns under these circumstances in the time allotted, not to mention the additional 20 restorations,” wrote [Dr. Avrum Goldstein,](https://www.seakexperts.com/members/4827-avrum-r-goldstein) a dentist and expert witness brought on by Wilson's attorney, in an affidavit. Goldstein, who is a faculty member at [NOVA Southeastern University](https://dental.nova.edu/aboutus/faculty/goldstein-avrum%20.html?_gl=1*1kqtqxq*_gcl_au*ODA4NzUxNTA1LjE3MDM3OTc5MjI.), also wrote that Wilson had been correctly diagnosed as having a "rare condition" causing decay in almost all of her teeth, but Mollderm's course of action was not a proper form of treatment. "[Wilson’s] required a slow, thoughtful, careful and measured response to her disease,” he said in his report. “Trying to fill every hole in every tooth in her mouth in one visit is not only the antithesis of what was indicated, it is not humanly possible to achieve in an effective or constructive manner.” Doctors remove wrong organ from man: [They opened him up to remove his appendix. They mistakenly took out much more, lawsuit says.](/story/news/health/2023/11/07/doctors-accidentally-remove-wrong-organ-surgery/71487292007/) The lawsuit also accused Mollderm of tampering with medical records to falsify the amount of anesthesia that was reportedly used, which in reality was nearly double the standard number of units, according to court paperwork. According to Goldstein, the maximum dose of anesthesia given in three hours should not exceed 490 mg, but Molldrem's records show he gave Wilson 960 mg. “Any negative cardiovascular or central nervous system outcomes could be tied to the local anesthetic overdose," he wrote. Wilson said in the suit that she has since had to have the dental work completely redone by other dentists to repair Molldrem’s “negligent work," an ongoing process that has caused her to lose income and rack up medical bills on top of enduring pain, suffering and embarrassment. She is seeking more than $50,000 in damages. Wilson's attorney and Molldrem did not immediately respond to request for comment.

title: Warming Shelter, Frontline Response, Atlanta, 14 January 2024
text:
Advertisement Come out and support our unhoused neighbors!
About this Event
We will be opening our Warming Center and we need your help to make it a smooth night for our guests who will be escaping the cold. Volunteers who sign up will be helping with the following:Setup: We need individuals to come in at 6pm to set up the beds. This would include changing out the pillow cases, making the bed and getting the dinner area ready to serve food.
Ride along: We would like volunteers to ride along with our drivers to pick up our guests from designated pick up spots. We want each of our guests to be greeted with a friendly smile and big hello as we open the doors to take them to the warming center.
Serving dinner: Each night we are open we want to be able to provide our guests who are unhoused a meal to eat. Volunteers would help to serve food to our guests and then are invited to sit and chat with them while they eat dinner.
It is a great time to connect with our unhoused friends and hear about things they enjoy, share some jokes and lend a listening ear.

title: On Doordarshan, President, CJI, CEC appeal to voters
text:
Participate in elections and strength democracy, say President, Chief Justice of India, Chief Election Commissioner and ISRO chief through Doordarshan In a first, top Constitutional office holders on Thursday appealed to the voters through Doordarshan National to come forward and exercise their franchise to further strengthen the Indian democracy.
Hours ahead of the first round of elections, President Droupadi Murmu exhorted the electorate, particularly the first-time voters, to participate in the polls and contribute to deciding the country's future. "India is the largest democracy in the world and also the mother of democracy...for us, election is the biggest festival and also a matter of national pride," she said, expressing the hope that people would come out to vote and strengthen the democratic ideals.
\n मतदान सशक्त, समृद्ध और समान भारत की दिशा में एक महत्वपूर्ण कदम है !
मतदान न केवल हमारा अधिकार है, बल्कि हमारी जिम्मेदारी भी है। आइए मिल कर सुनें भारत की राष्ट्रपति द्रौपदी मुर्मु जी का मतदाताओं के लिए जरूरी संदेश। @rashtrapatibhvn @ECISVEEP #ChunavKaParv #DeshKaGarv #ECI … pic.twitter.com/I8B9gSSrx3
— Doordarshan National दूरदर्शन नेशनल (@DDNational) \n April 18, 2024 \n
Chief Justice of India (CJI) D.Y. Chandrachud said: "...we are the citizens of the world's largest democracy. The Constitution gives us a multitude of rights as citizens, but it also expects that each of us performs the duty which is cast upon us, and one of the foremost duties of citizenship is to cast our vote.
"In a Constitutional democracy, the government is a government of the people, by the people and for the people, and we call it that because of the fact that each of us has a participatory role in electing the government," he said.
Recounting his experience as a first-time voter, the CJI said: "When I was young and I crossed the age of eligibility to vote, I remember the excitement in my heart, that for the first time I would be queuing up at the polling booth and exercising my franchise. Getting that dot on my finger when I voted aroused tremendous feelings of patriotism and association with the nation in me. Sometimes when you have an ink mark on your hand, you are wondering when that ink mark will go away, but this is one ink mark which I never wanted to go away, because I felt that I was a proud demonstrator of the fact that as an Indian citizen, having crossed the age of eligibility, I could exercise my vote and in fact exercised my vote."
Don't miss the opportunity: CJI
He said the day of election had always aroused wonderful feelings in him, the feeling that though he might be one in that big line of people who had come to vote, each of them counted as the same citizen with the same value. The CJI said: "So, our Constitution and our law provide for one citizen one vote and one value. I think that's the great tenacity and the power of our nation as a Constitutional democracy."
\n अपनी ताकत को पहचान, चलो करें हम सब मतदान।
विश्व में सबसे हो आगे, अपना भारत देश महान।
भारत के मुख्य न्यायाधीश डॉ जस्टिस डी वाई चंद्रचूड़ का मतदाताओं के लिए एक विशेष संदेश है। मतदान एक सशक्त और समृद्ध लोकतंत्र का परिचायक है। आइए सभी मिल कर अपनी भागीदारी निभाएं और मतदान करें।… pic.twitter.com/xd3PkVPqzA
— Doordarshan National दूरदर्शन नेशनल (@DDNational) \n April 18, 2024 \n
"When I became a lawyer and I had to run around in search of work in different places, both in Mumbai and outside, I was always worried that I should not be missing that one important day when I have to cast my vote, and I never missed that duty and obligation which is cast in me as an Indian citizen. Likewise, I request every one of you, please do not miss this opportunity to vote responsibly as citizens of our great motherland," he said.
Your turn now, says CEC
Chief Election Commissioner Rajiv Kumar said when he voted for the first time at the age of 21, it was like growing up to become a responsible citizen.
\n ये जो उंगली पर नीली सियाही है, मेरे मत-अधिकार की गवाही है।
कुछ ऐसा था भारत के Chief Election Commissioner @rajivkumarec का #FirstVotingExperience ! हर आवाज मायने रखती है, हर मतदान मायने रखता है। हमारे राष्ट्र के भविष्य को आकार देने में अपनी भागीदारी निभाएं। @ECISVEEP pic.twitter.com/F0aLdVUcth
— Doordarshan National दूरदर्शन नेशनल (@DDNational) \n April 18, 2024 \n
He said the EC officials had worked hard for over two years, adding every eligible voter to the electoral rolls, now having close to 97 crore voters, and preparing more than 10.50 lakh polling stations within two km of the voters' reach. "...now it is your turn, please come to polling station. Millennials and Gen Z, this century belongs to you. I hope citizens, especially the youth, will join the celebrations by visiting polling booths in large numbers...please come and vote," said Mr. Kumar.
It's an investment, says ISRO chief
S. Somanath, Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) Chairman, said: "...I still remember my first voting, but many years later, after so many elections and voting, I still make sure that I don't miss an opportunity to cast my vote.. because that is a right and a privilege that is given to every Indian citizen to select its representative to decide the future of the nation."
\n कदम वहीं पर बढ़े, जहां लोकतंत्र का हो सम्मान।
अपनी ताकत को पहचान, चलो करें हम सब मतदान।
मतदान पर #ISRO चीफ एस सोमनाथ का ये जरूरी संदेश हर मतदाता के लिए है। समय आ गया है कि हम सब मिल कर अपना नैतिक कर्तव्य निभाएं। मतदान अधिकार है, देश का सम्मान है। @isro @s_ssnath @ECISVEEP … pic.twitter.com/lvJYPhBqRu
— Doordarshan National दूरदर्शन नेशनल (@DDNational) \n April 18, 2024 \n
He urged people to cast their vote despite any prior family or personal commitments. "...make sure you do that, your vote is an investment in our scientific technological capabilities. When you vote, you vote for progress and a better tomorrow, your vote decides the direction that India takes as a nation," said Mr. Somanath.

title: How to Open a Drug Rehab Center: Essential Steps and Resources
text:
Introduction
The need for drug rehab centers has never been greater, as communities grapple with the escalating substance use crisis. Establishing a rehab center not only addresses a critical societal need but also provides a meaningful avenue for entrepreneurs committed to making a difference. This guide outlines the essential steps and resources required to open a drug rehab center, ensuring compliance, sustainability, and community impact.
Establishing a Path to Recovery
Creating a facility dedicated to helping individuals overcome addiction requires thorough planning and commitment. Understanding how to open a drug rehab center begins with selecting a suitable location and determining the scope of services, such as inpatient, outpatient, or detox programs. Compliance with local, state, and federal regulations is crucial, including obtaining the necessary licenses and certifications. Securing funding through grants, loans, or private investments is another vital step. Developing a strong team of qualified professionals and creating evidence-based treatment plans ensure high-quality care. A well-thought-out marketing strategy will help establish visibility and trust within the community.
Step 1: Research and Market Analysis
Identifying Community Needs and Demographic Analysis
Understanding the specific needs of your target community is the foundation of a successful rehab center. Conduct a thorough demographic analysis to identify age groups, income levels, and prevalent substance use issues in your area. This data will inform your center's services and outreach efforts.
Competitor Research and Understanding Service Gaps
Research existing rehab facilities in your area to determine service gaps you can address. For example, if most centers focus on outpatient care, consider offering residential treatment to fill a void. Differentiation is key to establishing a niche in the market.
Step 2: Developing a Business Plan
Defining Your Mission, Vision, and Goals
A clear mission and vision will guide your center’s operations and help communicate your purpose to stakeholders. Define your short-term and long-term goals, focusing on both patient outcomes and operational milestones.
Financial Planning and Budgeting Considerations
Startup costs for a rehab center can be significant, encompassing real estate, staffing, licensing, and equipment. Develop a detailed budget and explore funding options such as loans, grants, or partnerships. A well-structured business plan will also be crucial for attracting investors.
Step 3: Licensing and Accreditation
Meeting Local, State, and Federal Regulations
Compliance with regulatory requirements is non-negotiable. Research local, state, and federal laws governing healthcare facilities, including zoning laws, staffing requirements, and operational standards.
Navigating the Process of CARF and JCAHO Accreditation
Accreditation from bodies like CARF (Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities) or JCAHO (Joint Commission) enhances your credibility and ensures your center meets high-quality care standards. Begin the accreditation process early, as it can be time-consuming.
Step 4: Securing a Location and Facilities
Selecting the Right Site for Your Rehab Center
Location plays a critical role in accessibility and patient comfort. Choose a site that is easily accessible, has adequate space for treatment and living facilities, and complies with zoning regulations.
Facility Design and Compliance with Safety Standards
Your facility must be designed with patient safety and comfort in mind. This includes secure areas for detoxification, therapy rooms, recreational spaces, and accommodations that meet health and safety codes.
Step 5: Staffing Your Center
Hiring Qualified Clinical and Administrative Staff
The success of your rehab center depends on the expertise of your staff. Hire licensed therapists, counselors, medical professionals, and administrative personnel who are not only skilled but also empathetic to patients’ needs.
Importance of Training and Certifications
Regular training ensures that your team stays updated on the latest treatment protocols and industry standards. Encourage staff to pursue certifications in specialized areas such as trauma-informed care or addiction counseling.
Step 6: Implementing Treatment Programs
Designing Evidence-Based and Patient-Centered Treatment Plans
Effective treatment programs are grounded in evidence-based practices such as cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT), medication-assisted treatment (MAT), and group therapy. Tailor these programs to address individual patient needs for optimal outcomes.
Diversifying Services to Address Various Substance Use Disorders
Offer a range of services to cater to different stages of recovery, from detoxification and inpatient care to outpatient programs and aftercare support. This diversity enhances your center's appeal to a broader patient base.
Step 7: Marketing and Community Outreach
Establishing a Strong Online Presence
An effective online presence is essential for reaching potential patients and their families. Invest in a user-friendly website, optimize it for search engines, and maintain active social media profiles to engage your audience.
Building Partnerships with Local Healthcare Providers and Organizations
Collaborating with local hospitals, clinics, and community organizations can increase referrals and enhance your center’s reputation. Attend health fairs, host workshops, and participate in community events to build these relationships.
Step 8: Financial Sustainability and Growth
Exploring Revenue Streams and Payment Options
Revenue streams may include private pay, insurance reimbursements, and government grants. Offering flexible payment options, such as sliding-scale fees, can make your services accessible to a wider population.
Strategies for Scaling and Expanding Your Services
As your center grows, consider adding new services such as family therapy programs, vocational training, or telehealth options. Scaling strategically allows you to expand your impact while maintaining quality care.
Raising Standards in Behavioral Healthcare
Achieving excellence in behavioral health services requires a commitment to quality and compliance. JCAHO Accreditation for behavioral health is a prestigious designation that demonstrates an organization's adherence to rigorous standards in patient care, safety, and operational practices. The accreditation process involves thorough evaluations of policies, procedures, and service delivery methods to ensure they meet the Joint Commission's benchmarks. Beyond enhancing credibility, accreditation can also improve patient outcomes, attract higher-quality staff, and secure partnerships with payers. For organizations dedicated to continuous improvement, this recognition serves as both a milestone and a motivator to uphold the highest standards in behavioral healthcare.
Conclusion
Opening a drug rehab center is a complex but profoundly rewarding endeavor. By following these essential steps—conducting thorough research, ensuring compliance, building a strong team, and implementing effective programs—you can create a center that not only meets a critical need but also fosters hope and healing for individuals and their families. With the right resources and dedication, your rehab center can make a lasting impact on the community.
